org.openmarl.susrv

Class SuShell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmarl.susrv.SuShell

  • public class SuShell
extends Object
    Represents a SU Shell session oriented API, implemented above the native LibSusrv library.

    A shell session is bound to an application process after a successful initialization (getInstance()), and it remains associated to this process until invalidated through a call to exit(), or the associated native shell process dies abnormally.

    API calls that require a valid native shell session to be bound throw SuShellInvalidatedException when no such session exists for the requesting process.

    The shell session initializes a private file system (PFS), creating the following directories, all with permissions 0700: pfs_root/var, pfs_root/var/run, pfs_root/var/log, pfs_root/bin, pfs_root/lib, and pfs_root/tmp, where pfs_root is the application private storage path, as returned by Context.getFilesDir().getPath(). This is usually something like /data/data/com.android.phone/files.

    When a session is initialized with the smart flag, it sets the environment to include pfs_root/bin in PATH, and pfs_root/lib in LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and immediately changes its working directory to pfs_root.

    The shell log file, containing commands output and debug info, is available in the directory pfs_root/var/log.

    Author:
    t0kt0ckus

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SuShell getInstance(android.content.Context ctx,
                  boolean smartFlag)
        Opens or initializes the SU shell session bound to the requesting process.
        Parameters:
        ctx - A valid context.
        smartFlag - If true, the shell environment is updated to include this session's PFS.
        Returns:
        An initialized SU shell session ready to accept commands, or null when a suitable session didn't exist, and a new one could not be created.

      • getInstance

        public static SuShell getInstance()
        Answers the current SU shell session, if any.
        Returns:
        A valid shell session, or null if the requesting process isn't currently bound to any shell session.

      • addObserver

        public int addObserver(SuShellLifecycleObserver observer)
        Adds a life-cycle observer. The registered observer will be notified when this shell session becomes invalid. Note that observers are notified only once upon session invalidation.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer.
        Returns:
        The current count of observers.

      • removeObserver

        public int removeObserver(SuShellLifecycleObserver observer)
        Removes a life-cycle observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - The no more interested observer.
        Returns:
        The current count of observers.

      • getPfsRoot

        public String getPfsRoot()
        Answers the path to the application PFS's root.
        Returns:
        Something like /data/data/com.example.app/files.

      • getTmp

        public String getTmp()
        Answers the PFS's temp directory.

        This directory is cleared upon application restart.

        Returns:
        Its absolute path.

      • ping

        public boolean ping()
        Tells whether a valid shell session is currently bound to the requesting process.
        Returns:
        true if this is the case.

      • getTtyPath

        public String getTtyPath()
        Answers the path to the shell's session log file.
        Returns:
        Its absolute path, or null when not available.

      • setTtyEcho

        public void setTtyEcho(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables echo-ing "terminal" output to session log file.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to echo commands output to the session's log file, false for a silent session.

      • getTtyEcho

        public boolean getTtyEcho()
        Tells whether "terminal" echo is enabled on the current shell session.
        Returns:
        true when such a session exists and echo is enabled.

      • getLastTtyLine

        public String getLastTtyLine()
        Answers the last line red on the session terminal.
        Returns:
        The last available line, or null if not available.

      • importAsset

        public int importAsset(String rawAsset,
              String dirPath,
              String filename,
              boolean isExec)
        Imports an asset into the application private storage.

        This neither requires any privilege, nor is implemented as a native call.

        Parameters:
        rawAsset - The asset name, that is its file name within the application raw resources folder.
        dirPath - The destination directory path relative to PFS's root.
        filename - The destination filename.
        isExec - When true, the destination file will be executable.
        Returns:
        The imported asset size in bytes on success, 0 when the asset name is undefined, or a negative value on error.

      • importExecutable

        public int importExecutable(String rawAsset,
                   String filename)
        Imports an asset as an executable into pfs_root/bin.

        This neither requires any privilege, nor is implemented as a native call.

        Parameters:
        rawAsset - The asset name, that is its file name within the application raw resources folder.
        filename - The destination file name.
        Returns:
        The imported asset size in bytes on success, 0 when the asset name is undefined, or a negative value on error.

      • importLibrary

        public int importLibrary(String rawAsset,
                String filename)
        Imports an asset as a shared library into pfs_root/lib.

        This neither requires any privilege, nor is implemented as a native call.

        Parameters:
        rawAsset - The asset name, that is its file name within the application raw resources folder.
        filename - The destination file name.
        Returns:
        The imported asset size in bytes on success, 0 when the asset name is undefined, or a negative value on error.

      • importTmp

        public int importTmp(String rawAsset,
            String filename)
        Imports an asset as a temporary file in pfs_root/tmp.

        This does not require any privilege, and is not accomplished through the native SU shell session.

        Parameters:
        rawAsset - The asset name, that is its file name within the application raw resources folder.
        filename - The destination file name.
        Returns:
        The imported asset size in bytes on success, 0 when the asset name is undefined, or a negative value on error.

      • getpid

        public int getpid(String procname)
        Answers the PID of the first process which name matches a given application name.

        This is an unprivileged native call, reading Linux proc filesystem.

        Parameters:
        procname - The process entry to search for, for example com.example.app.
        Returns:
        A non-zero PID, or a negative number on error.

      • getproclist

        public String[] getproclist()
        Answers the list of current process names.

        This is an unprivileged native call, reading Linux /proc filesystem.

        Returns:
        The list of process names, as defined by /proc/pid/cmdline.

      • exit

        public int exit()
        Invalidates the current shell session, releasing native resources.
        Returns:
        0 when the current session has been properly closed, LibSusrv.NO_SESSION_ERR, or an error code when during native shell shutdown failed.

      • exec

        public int exec(String command)
         throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Executes a shell command within the current SU shell session.
        Parameters:
        command - The command string to execute.
        Returns:
        The command exit code, usually zero (0) on success, or INVALID_RESULT_ERR.
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.

      • chmod

        public int chmod(String path,
        int mode)
          throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Within the current SU shell session, changes a file or directory permissions.
        Parameters:
        path - The file or directory path.
        mode - The UNIX permission mask (usually as in octal).
        Returns:
        The command exit code, typically 0 on success.
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.

      • mkdir

        public int mkdir(String path,
        int mode)
          throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Within the current SU shell session, creates a new directory and set its permissions.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory path.
        mode - The UNIX permission mask (usually as in octal).
        Returns:
        The command exit code, typically 0 on success.
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.

      • cp

        public int cp(String sourcePath,
     String destinationPath,
     int mode)
       throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Within the current SU shell session, copy file(s) from and to the device filesystem.
        Parameters:
        sourcePath - The source path, may contain wildcards.
        destinationPath - The destination path.
        mode - The UNIX permission mask (usually as in octal).
        Returns:
        The command exit code, typically 0 on success.
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.

      • cd

        public int cd(String cwdPath)
       throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Within the current SU shell session, changes the current working directory.
        Parameters:
        cwdPath - The new working directory.
        Returns:
        The command exit code, typically 0 on success.
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.

      • cpa

        public int cpa(String rawAsset,
      String destinationPath,
      int mode)
        throws SuShellInvalidatedException
        Within the current SU shell session, copy an application raw asset to the device filesystem.

        To copy assets to the application private storage, prefer importAsset(String, String, String, boolean).

        Parameters:
        rawAsset - The asset name, that is its file name within the application raw resources folder.
        destinationPath - The destination file path.
        mode - The UNIX permission mask (usually as in octal).
        Returns:
        The command exit code. (see cp(String, String, int)).
        Throws:
        SuShellInvalidatedException - When this session has been invalidated.
